bill_title: require the Corrections Commission to review any proposal to establish or increase mandatory minimum sentences.

bill_versions.bill_text: FOR AN ACT ENTITLED, An Act to require the Corrections Commission to review any proposal to establish or increase mandatory minimum sentences. BE IT ENACTED BY THE LEGISLATURE OF THE STATE OF SOUTH DAKOTA: Section 1. Any person before proposing to the Legislature the establishment of, or an increase to, any mandatory minimum sentence shall submit the proposal to the Corrections Commissions not later than July first. The Corrections Commission shall review and assess the merits of the proposal and determine the impact the proposal would have on the corrections system. If the proposal is subsequently introduced in the Legislature, the Corrections Commission shall submit to the Legislature its recommendation with regard to the proposal. The Corrections Commission shall base any recommendation on evidence gathered by the commission in public hearings from testimony submitted orally or in writing by interested parties and on evidence compiled by the commission in its study. 750 copies of this document were printed by the South Dakota Legislative Research Council at a cost of $.016 per page. . Insertions into existing statutes are indicated by underscores. Deletions from existing statutes are indicated by overstrikes.

FOR AN ACT ENTITLED, An Act to require the Corrections Commission to review any proposal to establish or increase mandatory minimum sentences. BE IT ENACTED BY THE LEGISLATURE OF THE STATE OF SOUTH DAKOTA: Section 1. Any person before proposing to the Legislature the establishment of, or an increase to, any mandatory minimum sentence shall submit the proposal to the Corrections Commissions not later than December thirty-first. The Corrections Commission shall review and assess the merits of the proposal and determine the impact the proposal would have on the corrections system. If the proposal is subsequently introduced in the Legislature, the Corrections Commission shall submit to the Legislature its recommendation with regard to the proposal. The Corrections Commission shall base any recommendation on evidence gathered by the commission in public hearings from testimony submitted orally or in writing by interested parties and on evidence compiled by the commission in its study. BILL HISTORY 1/22/99 First read in Senate and referred to Judiciary. S.J. 161 1/25/99 Scheduled for Committee hearing on this date. 1/29/99 Scheduled for Committee hearing on this date. 1/29/99 Judiciary Do Pass Amended, Passed, AYES 5, NAYS 2. S.J. 251

FOR AN ACT ENTITLED, An Act to require the Corrections Commission to review any proposal to establish or increase mandatory minimum sentences. BE IT ENACTED BY THE LEGISLATURE OF THE STATE OF SOUTH DAKOTA: Section 1. Any person before proposing to the Legislature the establishment of, or an increase to, any mandatory minimum sentence shall submit the proposal to the Corrections Commissions not later than December thirty-first. This requirement does not apply to bills which provide that the sentencing court may impose a sentence other than that specified if the court finds, in writing, that mitigating circumstances exist which require a departure from the mandatory sentence proposed. The Corrections Commission shall review and assess the merits of the proposal and determine the impact the proposal would have on the corrections system. If the proposal is subsequently introduced in the Legislature, the Corrections Commission shall submit to the Legislature its recommendation with regard to the proposal. The Corrections Commission shall base any recommendation on evidence gathered by the commission in public hearings from testimony submitted orally or in writing by interested parties and on evidence compiled by the commission in its study. BILL HISTORY 1/22/99 First read in Senate and referred to Judiciary. S.J. 161 1/25/99 Scheduled for Committee hearing on this date. 1/29/99 Scheduled for Committee hearing on this date. 1/29/99 Judiciary Do Pass Amended, Passed, AYES 5, NAYS 2. S.J. 251 2/2/99 Motion to Amend, Passed. S.J. 305 2/2/99 Senate Do Pass Amended, Failed, AYES 16, NAYS 18. S.J. 305 2/2/99 Intent to reconsider, AYES 19, NAYS 15. S.J. 306 2/2/99 Senate Do Pass Amended, Passed, AYES 17, NAYS 17. S.J. 306
